title: Regular AR Verbs
rules: for nosotros, present and preterite are the same
subjunctive is present with an e

examples: Le echaré un vistazo. / I will have a look at it.
No planeé hacerlo. / I didn't plan on doing that.
Todo está planeado. / Everything was planned.
El consejo se reunió para planear la estrategia. / The council met to plan strategy.
Yo me ducho todas las mañanas. / I take a shower every morning.
No duches al gato. / Don't spray the cat.
¡Me encanta la playa! / I love the beach!
La comida basura no es saludable, pero a los niños les encanta. / Junk food is unhealthy, but children love it.
Mi esposa me regaló un libro. / My wife gave me a book.
Lograron sofocar el incendio. / They were able to smother the fire.
No lo lograremos. / We won't make it.
Deberías haber girado a la derecha. / You should have turned right.
Estoy bastante seguro de que no deberíamos haber girado a la derecha allí atrás. / I'm pretty sure we shouldn't have taken a right back there.
No paramos para comer, así que tenemos hambre ahorita. / We did not stop to eat, therefore we are hungry right now.
Me está fallando la memoria. / My memory is failing me.

listOld: quedar (remain), hablar, llevar (bring), dejar (abandon), llamar, tomar (take a drink), tratar (treat), mirar (look at), entrar, trabajar, terminar, necesitar (require), resultar, cambiar, presentar, crear, considerar, acabar (finish), ganar (gain), formar, aceptar, lograr (attain), estudiar, preguntar, gustar (please), escuchar (listen), levantar (to get up), intentar (attempt), usar, olvidar (forget), ocupar, fijar (to fasten), comprar (buy), evitar (avoid), interesar, importar, observar, imaginar, desarrollar (to develop), señalar (to indicate), preparar, faltar (to lack), acompañar, desear (desire), enseñar (to teach), representar, mandar (to give an order), asegurar (to secure), guardar, iniciar, bajar (to lower), notar, cortar (to cut), aprovechar (to take advantage of), apoyar (to support), aumentar (to increase), abandonar, expresar

list.rules: present: estoy, estás, está, están, preterite: estuv-, future: estar-, subjunctive: esté, estés, esté, estén
c to qu before e: present: dediqué, subjunctive: dedique...
examples: Me dediqué a terminar mi trabajo. / I dedicated myself to finishing my work.

list.rules: e to ie when stressed, present: pienso, piensas, ..., subjunctive: piense, pienses, ...
o to ue; present: cuento, cuentas, cuenta, cuentan
examples: Sé contar hasta cien. / I can count to one hundred.
Cuando la escuché contar su experiencia, me entraron ganas de viajar a Nueva Zelanda. / When I heard her telling of her experience, I had a desire to travel to New Zealand.

list.rules: c to qu; preterite: saqué; subjunctive: (all)
examples: ¿Sacaste una foto? / Did you take a photo?
Yo tendré que sacarle el diente. / I'll have to pull out a tooth.

list.rules: i to í; present: envío, envías, envía, -, -, envían; subjunctive: envíe, envíes, envíe, -, -, envían
examples: Enviaremos la caja a su ciudad. / We'll ship the box to your city.

present-subjunctive-o-to-ue-when-accente: encontrar, contar, recordar, mostrar, demonstrar, acordar (to decide, acordarse = to remember), costar
preteriteYo-subjunctive-z-to-c-before-e: realizar, alcanzar (to reach, catch up), utilizar, lanzar, avanzar
preteriteYo-and-subjunctive-c-to-qu-befo: buscar, sacar, explicar, tocar, acercar (to approach), dedicar, indicar, significar, collocar (to locate), aplicar

list.rules: present: soy, eres, es, somos, sois, son; imperfect: era, eras, era, éramos, erais, eran; preterite: fui, fuiste, fue, fuimos, fuisteis, fueron; subjunctive: sea, seas, sea, seamos, seáis, sean
present: hago, preterite: hic-/hiz-, future/conditional: har-, subjunctive: haga...
tengo, tienes, tuv-, tendr-, ten-
he, has, ha, hub-, habr-
e to ie; present: quiero...; preterite: quis-; future/conditional: querr
present: pongo, -, -, -, -; presentPerfect: puesto; preterite: pus-; future: pondr-; subjunctive: pong-
examples: Ponga eso por escrito. / Put that in writing.
Ella es linda sin importar lo que se ponga. / She's beautiful regardless what she wears.

list.rules: compongo, compongas, compus-, compondr-, compuesto/compondiendo
i to ie: entiendo...
o to ue: puedo, pud-, podr-, pudiendo
present: voy, vas, va, vamos, vais, van; imperfect: iba, ibas, iba, íbamos, ibais, iban; preterite: fui, fuiste, fue, fuimos, fuisteis, fueron; subjunctive: vaya, vayas, vays, vayamos, vayáis, vayan
escrito
introduzco, preterite: introduje, introdujo, introdujeron, subjunctive: introduzca, introduzcas, ...
examples: Él introdujo la llave en la cerradura. / He inserted the key in the lock.

list.rules: e to ie, present: sugiero..., preterite: sugirió, sugirieron, subjunctive: sugiera...
e to i; present: consigo, consigues, consigue, consiguen; preterite: consiguió, consiguieron; subjunctive: consiga...
examples: No consigo encontrar mi reloj. / I can't find my watch.
No sé cómo, pero lo consigo. / I don't know how, but I'll manage it.
¿Dónde consigo equipo para deportes acuáticos? / Where do I get equipment for water sports?
